item.title: Sr Technical Program Manager - Merchandising - 036357 (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Are you interested in defining goals and directions for some of the most important platform services in Amazon? The Website Behavior/Community Platform team is responsible for a number of company critical internal systems, including:
 
         Clickstream: collecting and distributing client and server-side customer behavior data (billions of records) that is provided to dozens of teams across Amazon to power automation and reporting tools.
         Weblab: Amazon’s A/B experimentation framework that is used by every team across the company to validate website and feature changes.
         Website Analytics: near-real time sales and analytics behavior data used b y VPs across the company.
         Platform Search: owns dozens of search indices with over 1 billion documents serving both external customers (e.g. Reviews and People search) and employees (e.g. the Customer Service team).
         Community Platform: responsible for providing core elements of the Amazon Community space (e.g. reviews and discussion) to all of our merchant partners
 
Within these areas, the TPM will:
         Develop business requirements and functional specifications.
         Coordinate development efforts across the company.
         Assist in providing ongoing technical support across the company.
         Lead the evangelization of the team’s projects to our customers as well as being the primary conduit for gathering requirements from these customers.
         Interact at all levels of Amazon.com, frequently answering to senior leadership on status and direction.
 

QUALIFICATIONS:

A thorough understanding of software processes (development, configuration, testing, and deployment) is critical in this role. The TPM must be able to credibly coordinate between technical teams and business stakeholders. The TPM should be able to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines. Also required is an ability to mentor junior engineers, gain consensus on technical decisions, and ensure that appropriate software engineering practices are employed to deliver high quality results.
 
Qualifications and Requirements
         Maturity, judgment, negotiation/influence skills, analytical skills, and leadership skills are essential and critical.
         Must be able to define product roadmaps based on customer needs and strategic direction, and ensure that committed projects are delivered on schedule by the engineering team.
         Excellent written and oral communication skills including an ability to communicate with all levels in the organization (technical, business, executive).
         An entrepreneurial spirit with strong program and product management skills.
         Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline required.
         5-7 years industry experience in software engineering, with a record of successful delivery of software systems as an individual/team leader.
 
 

Amazon.com is recruiting for Seattle-based opportunities. Relocation to Seattle, WA is required.
